name: ART-DECOR
description:
DECOR (Data Elements, Codes, OIDs and Rules) is a methodology to record the information model used by health professionals. DECOR uses this model to generate various artifacts: documentation, XML- and test-tooling, etc. With DECOR it is possible to improve the recorded information model by generating and resolving issues per item. DECOR registers (amongst others) datasets, datatypes, valuesets, codes, identifications, and business rules. 
ART (Advanced Requirement Tooling) is the DECOR user interface to create and adapt DECOR files, and to generate artifacts from DECOR files. ART is based on the eXist XML database, XQuery and Orbeon XForms.
purpose: Supports the creation and maintenance of HL7 templates, value sets, data sets and features cloud-based federated Building Block Repositories (BBR) for Templates and Value Sets with two Template Editors. It supports comprehensive collaboration of team members within and between governance groups.

name: eTransX
description: Offers a dramatically simplified approach to internal and external data integration for hospitals, laboratories, clinics, ACOs and much more.
purpose: Supports the HL7 interface development.

The Iguana integration engine is the fastest way to create any interface, regardless of standard or protocol.

name: HL7 Interface Engine IDE/  eiConsole

name: MD Link - HL7 Integration Engine with HL7 Interface Development
description: MD Link is an integration engine that connects independent health care applications in hospitals and clinics, with interfaces supported by HL7 certified resources. By displaying data sources and processes as a visual solution, MD Link enables robust information exchange between legacy applications and commercial software.
purpose: Integration engine that delivers advanced inter-system messaging capabilities to health care organizations and vendors. All managed from a single screen with drag-and-drop configuration and supported by HL7 Certified resources.

name: LINK Medical Computing, Inc. Toolkits for Building/Parsing HL7 Messages
description: LINK Medical Computing, Inc. specializes in providing Health Level Seven (HL7) integration tools and solutions to the healthcare industry. The LINKTools Interface Development Kit (IDK) is a cost-effective HL7 integration toolkit that allows Vendors, Developers, Hospital IT administrators and consultants to rapidly "interface enable" their applications and systems without programming.
purpose: Supports the HL7 development of an interface for applications and systems.

name: HL7 V3 PubDb
description: V3 Publication Database. Provides an Access database that is used by Work Groups to define their specifications and the dynamic models for those.
purpose: Support for workgroups in defining specifications and the dynamic models.

name: HL7 V3 Design Repository
description: This project contains four packages: HL7 "CoreMif" Instances of RIM, Vocab Data Types and CMETinfo; HL7 Design/RIM Repository, CMETinfo and FormalNamingSource.
purpose: Provide the core RIM definitions for use in development of V3 artifacts

name: The HL7 RMIM Designer
description: A graphic designer that supports the design of HL7 static information models. The Current variant of this tool is built upon customized "templates" in Microsoft Visio; a suite of Visual Basic software that runs in the Visio application space; and modules (DLL's) from the RoseTree program. The tool provides an interactive design capability for HL7 RMIMs, and is programmed to use data from the RIM, Vocabulary, and Data Types specifications to enforce the model design rules expressed in the HL7 V3 Methodology.
purpose: Supports the design of HL7 static information models

name: Rose Tree
description: RoseTree is a donated Visual Basic (VB) application that functions as an interface to the HL7 repository for several other applications, including the current RMIM Designer, the PubDb and the V3 Generator (for which RoseTree creates source files). In addition, it provides a browser for the HL7 RIM and Vocabulary; builds RMIMs and HMDs from Visio designs; and manages the repository storage of these.
purpose:
Provides a browser for the HL7 RIM and Vocabulary;
provides functions to assemble the HL7 Vocabulary from the Vocabulary data base (in Access)
generates Vocabulary MIF files after the assembly
generates XML extracts from Publication Database (PubDb) for desktop and production publishing.

name: V3 Generator
description: The V3 Generator accepts the XML expressions of an HMD and, through a series of transforms, generates HL7 artifacts including: Static schemas, Interaction schemas, HTML table views, CSV files for Excel views and MIF files for static models, data types, and vocabulary.
purpose: Converting static models to MIF and related formats.

name: HL7 Eclipse Platform
description:
The Open Health Workbench is the open-source subset of the clinical modeling and data standards tooling platform used by the English National Health Service. B2 International developed the Open Health Workbench in close cooperation with the English National Health Service to improve their real-world HL7 version 3 implementation issues. As the primary adopter of HL7 v3, NHS Connecting for Health is particularly well-suited to identify tooling to improve their message development tasks.
Components
    Static Model Comparison (MIF Diff)
    Message Instance Editor
    MIF Editor
    Validation Framework
    Test Message Generator
purpose: Support the development of HL7 v3 messages.

name: MIF Schemas
description: The Model Interchange Format (MIF) is a set of XML formats used to support the storage and exchange of HL7 version 3 artefacts as part of the HL7 Development Framework (HDF). It is the pre-publication format of HL7 v3 artefacts used by tooling. The formats are defined by a set inter-related schemas.
purpose:
Serves to document the HL7 metamodel, identifying all data elements of interest to version 3, as well as indicating correspondance to the UML meta-model.
defining schemas for xml files for holding the content of HL7 v3 specifications

name: MIF Utilities
description: This is a set of tools used in the comparison of MIFs.
purpose: Supports the comparison of MIFs.

name: OID Registry
description: An OID is a globally unique ISO (International Organization for Standardization) identifier. Registered OIDs are presented in the OID Registry.
purpose:
creation of OIDs for HL7 users
registry for OIDs

name: Table 0396 Coding Systems
description: This is a table of external coding systems used in HL7 messages.

name: UML Profile for MIF Static Models
description:
Document a UML Profile for the semantics in the MIF representation of the RIM and other derived models - identifying those concepts that cannot be expressed in UML Profile language to provide to OMG for possible extension of UML
Using the resulting UML Profile, adapt Enterprise Architect to express the proper HL7 stereotypes as a proof of concept.
purpose: To allow modelers and developers to apply MIF-UML with minimal effort in order to create new models or change existing models and ultimately to produce MIF artifacts directly in UML

name: Mayo Lexical Grid
description: The Lexical Grid Vision - a distributed network of terminological resources. Currently, there are many terminologies and ontologies in existence. But just about every terminology has its own format, its own set of tools, and its own update mechanisms. The only thing that most of these pieces have in common with each other is their incompatibility. This makes it very hard to use these resources to their full potential.
purpose: Provides a way to bridge terminologies and ontologies with a common set of tools, formats and update mechanisms.

name: HL7 Development Framework
description: The HL7 Development Framework (HDF) details the process of the HL7 standard development methodology. The HDF is a framework of modeling and administrative processes, policies, and deliverables used by HL7 to produce specifications that are used by the healthcare information management community to overcome challenges and barriers to interoperability among computerized healthcare-related information systems.
purpose: The HDF project is intended to define and maintain the methodology applied by all the committees for project initiation, requirements analysis, standard design, implementation, standard approval process, etc.
Notes: Health Level 7 (HL7) Development Framework (HDF) is included in the 'Background documents' on the site. The HDF is an informative document.

name: Installing and Configuring HL7 Tools
description: These pages provide documentation on installing HL7 tools, configuring operating systems and COTS tools (like Visio) for using these tools, etc.
purpose: Provide documentation on installing HL7 tools, configuring operating systems and COTS tools (like Visio) for using these tools, etc.

name: Reference Information Model
description: The Reference Information Model (RIM) is the cornerstone of the HL7 Version 3 development process. An object model created as part of the Version 3 methodology, the RIM is a large, pictorial representation of the HL7 clinical data (domains) and identifies the life cycle that a message or groups of related messages will carry. It is a shared model between all domains and, as such, is the model from which all domains create their messages. The RIM is an ANSI approved standard.
purpose: The RIM in different formats

name: Submit HL7 v3 proposals
description: HL7 has an online database to track proposals for modifications/additions to the V3 standard.  HL7 members should submit their proposals online via http://www.hl7.org/memonly/dbsub.cfm (Submit V3 Proposals link under the Members Only section).
purpose: Supports HL7 leadership in tracking change requests to the V3 standard.

name: V3 Glossary
description: The V3 Glossary is published as part of the Version 3 Ballot Web Site.
purpose: Supports the understanding of terms used within HL7 v3.

name: HL7 Glossary of Terms
description: An overview, in alphabetical order, of all the terms used within HL7 and their definition as used within HL7.
purpose: Supports the development and implementation of HL7 standards.

name: V3 Guide
description: The V3 Guide was created for use by members of the HL7 Working Group as a companion to the Version 3 Standard.
purpose: Provide guidance on HL7 v3 standard

name: Version 3 Substantivity Guide
description: The V3 Substantive Change document is published as part of the Version 3 Ballot Web Site. This document (in the section Background documents) provides some general principles as well as specific rules and examples of what changes are substantive. It also provides some reference material on the role substantive change plays in the HL7 balloting process.
purpose: The purpose of this document is to give guidance to Health Level Seven (HL7) Technical Committee (TC) Chairs in determining whether a change to a Version 3 Specification is Substantive.
Notes: The current V3 Ballot Web Site is always available at: http://www.hl7.org/v3ballot/html/welcome/introduction/index.htm. After clicking into the V3 Ballot Web Site content pages from the Introduction page, use the left-hand navigation tree to go to Background Documents/Substantive Change.

name: Web Widget
description: This web widget component enables XML-based authoring of Healthcare standards payloads. It simplifies the buildup of HL7 markup for V3 based rich text, namely <hl7:text> element, and better enables richer web applications based on Ajax and XForms.

name:
HL7 Version 2.5.1 ELR 
Implementation Guide:  
Electronic Laboratory Reporting to Public Health, 
Release 1 (US Realm)
description: The Version 2.5.1 Implementation Guide: Electronic Laboratory Reporting to Public Health (US Realm), Release 1 describes the transmission of laboratory-reportable findings to appropriate local, state, territorial and federal health agencies using the message. In particular, this guide addresses messaging content and dynamics related to the transmission of Laboratory Reportable Result Messages (i.e.,. Electronic Laboratory Reporting, or ELR). This guide is designed to align as closely as possible with the Version 2.5.1 Implementation Guide: Interoperable Laboratory Result Reporting to EHR.
purpose: Supports the implementation of V2 messages for electronic laboratory reporting.

name: HAPI Tool
description: HAPI (HL7 application programming interface) is an open-source, object-oriented HL7 2x parser for JAVA.
purpose: Validates HL7 V2x messages.

name: HAPI FHIR
description: An open-source implementation of the FHIR specification in Java.
purpose: Supports the HL7 FHIR implementation for Java.

name: HL7 Conformance Testing with Message Maker
description: The Message Maker Project is a collaboration effort between the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) and the Health Level 7 (HL7) Standards Consortium. NIST is directing their efforts towards the development of a conformance-testing tool that automatically generates test messages for HL7 message profile specifications. The messages can be used to test systems for conformance. A prototype of Message Maker is available at this site. All NIST produced source code, documents, and associated products are in the public domain. Message Maker is a work-in-progress, as such, not all planned functionality is implemented; feedback on its design, feature set, and usefulness is welcomed.
purpose: Supports conformance testing.
Remarks: Tool is developed in collaboration by NIST and HL7. Download of the tool is for free, but nothing about open source. So I selected free for the license.

name: HL7 Version 2.x Message Profiling Specification
description: HL7 V2.x Message Profiling provides a guideline for documenting particular uses of HL7 messages.  A defined V2.x message profile will be registered with HL7 and may be reused by other HL7 users, moving the HL7 V2.x standard closer to “plug and play” interfaces.
purpose:
This document is intended to:
• Describe the HL7 V2.x Message Profile concept
• Recommend a specification for defining specific message profiles of HL7 V2.x messages
• Facilitate HL7 V2.x interpretation by users familiar with the HL7 standard, reducing interface analysis time and dissatisfaction with the HL7 V2.x standard.
Remarks: The referral to the HL7 website specially the workgroup needs to changed in a referral to the CGIT workgroup. AG;done
Notes:
In its current form, this document is only a recommendation and should not be considered an HL7 standard.
For updates to this document and related information, visit the Conformance Special Interest Group; http://www.hl7.org/Special/committees/ictc/index.cfm

name: Messaging Workbench
description:
Messaging Workbench or MWB was developed by the late Peter Rontey at the Department of Veteran Affairs.

The tool allows an array of functionality most prominently allowing creation of conformance profiles, specification messages etc. based off of HL7 V2.x. The idea is to allow implementers to test their profiles/implementations before they begin participation in conformance and interoperability testing.
purpose: Supports the development of conformance profiles,   messages etc. based on HL7 v2x.
Remarks: Not clear if the HL7 website has an up to date information. AS: likely not, we will need to talk to Matt Graham at Mayo to get info on MWB

name: V2.x Proposals Database
description: A database for entering and tracking suggestions and corrections to the V2 messaging standard.
purpose: Giving an overview and tracking system for proposals on the HL7 v2.x database.

name: v2.xml Example Messages

purpose: Supports the development of messages based on HL7 v2x. Standard

name: Version 2 Substantivity Guide
description: Guidelines for HL7 V2.x substantive change.
purpose: Defines substansive changes in HL7 v2.x

name: Training and Certification Events
description: An overview of training and certification events.
purpose: Gives an agenda of training and certification options.

name: HL7 Training
description: HL7 training programs provide knowledge and support to guide the healthcare industry through successful implementation of HL7 standards. HL7 offers on-site tutorials and workshops that can be customized to meet specific needs. HL7 training is also available at Working Group Meetings and Implementation Workshops.
purpose: Gives information on HL7 Training and an agenda of the training.

name: HL7 Certification
description: HL7 offers certification testing to help professionals achieve industry-recognized levels of proficiency and expertise. Advance your career and enhance your marketability by adding "HL7 Certified" to your credentials.
purpose: Gives information on HL7 Certification and an agenda of certification events.

name: Training materials
description: See row 95

name: Managing the Sparx Enterprise Architect Software Keys Distribution
description: Sparx has offered to supply Enterprise Architect licenses to HL7 International members working on HL7 projects.  The HL7 Tooling Administrator will be responsible for maintaining the list of HL7 projects using Sparx Enterprise Architect and members who have been assigned license keys. The HL7 Tooling Administrator will also act as a mediator between HL7 and Sparx’s contact person, John Redfern, to assist HL7 members needing assistance supported by Sparx.
purpose: The objective of this document is to outline the process for the HL7 Tooling Administrator to track the Sparx Enterprise Architect software keys distribution and to ensure that all recipients of the Sparx software have met the criteria recommended by the Tooling Work Group and accepted by the Technical Steering Committee.
Notes: The support url is the url to the Sparx website for support.

name: Request IBM Rational Software Modeler (RSM)
description: A request form for the IBM Rational Software Modeler (RSM). The IBM Rational Software Development Platform is an Eclipse-based common development environment. It is an integrated platform that allows the user to manage and trace a project from requirements through design and development. Rational Software Modeler is a Unified Modeling Language (UML)-based visual modeling and design tool for architects, systems analysts, and designers who need to ensure that their specifications, architecture, and designs are clearly defined and communicated to their stakeholders.
purpose: Supports the request of IBM Rational Software Modeler (RSM).

name: GForge (HL7 Project Homebase)
description: GForge, the HL7 Project Homebase site is intended to support HL7 Tool Developers (Toolsmiths) and Work Groups in managing their projects. All of the tools available on this Homebase are designed to support the development and publication of HL7 Version 3 Messaging Standards. These tools carry a license that restricts their use to activities that support the development of standards by HL7 and the HL7 International Affiliate Organizations.
purpose: Supports HL7 tool developers and and work group co-chairs in managing the projects.
Notes: GForge assists in the management of the entire development life cycle using Collaborative Development Environment (CDE) tools to assist a team in working together, using message forums and mailing lists, including tools to create and control access to Source Code Management (SCM) repositories. GForge automatically creates a repository and controls access to it depending on the role security settings of the Project.

name: Guidance for Steering Division Co-Chairs to Evaluate Work Group Capacity to Undertake New Effort
description: This document provides guidance for Steering Division Co-Chairs on using PBS (Projects, Ballots and Standards) Metrics and Work Group Health to evaluate WG capacity to undertake new effort.
purpose:
Guidance for Steering Division Co-Chairs
Using PBS Metrics and Work Group Health to evaluate WG capacity to undertake new effort
Notes:
More about Work Group Health at the wiki, http://hl7tsc.org/wiki/index.php?title=Work_Group_Health

To update projects in Project Insight please go to http://www.hl7.org/documentcenter/public/wg/projectServices/Project%20Insight%20Tip%20Sheet_2011.doc

name: HL7 Ballot Guide
description: The HL7 Ballot Guide (formerly titled Electronic Ballot Charts)  provides a quick reference to information related to each level of HL7 electronic balloting.
purpose: Guidance for the different levels of HL7 electronic balloting.
Notes: The Ballot Guides in this document were developed as a supplement to the HL7 Co-Chair Handbook (http://www.hl7.org/permalink/?CoChairHandbook) to provide a quick reference to information related to each level of HL7 balloting.

name: HL7 Searchable Project Database
description: Search active and archived HL7 projects along with 3-Year Plan items. This tool displays information from Project Insight based on Project Scope Statements as well as project status updates.
purpose: Supports HL7 members to get information on HL7 projects.

name: PBS Metrics Report
description: The Projects, Ballots and Standards Metrics Report (PBS Metrics) provides a dashboard by Work Group as well as details about Projects that are behind 120+ days, missing 3-Year Plans, unpublished ballots, unpublished CMETs, and balloted items with outstanding negatives that require a recirculation ballot to be published.
purpose: Supports Work Groups in tracking their projects an their Work Group Health.

name: Peer Review Process at HL7
description: Describes step process and references various forms to help conduct a peer review.
purpose: Give guidance on conducting a peer review at HL7.

name: Project Facilitator Responsibilities
description: Describes responsibilities of this role, traits desired of individuals filling these roles and the tasks expected.
purpose: The purpose of this document is to describe the Work Group Project Facilitator roles and responsibilities.

name: Project Insight Tip Sheet
description: This document illustrates how to update project status information in Project Insight, how Project Insight data changes throughout the lifecycle of a project (i.e. as it moves from a 3-Year Plan to an active project and through balloting to closure), and how a Project is closed (archived) in Project Insight. The document includes screen shots, Project Insight field definitions and a State Transition Diagram.
purpose: Give guidance in how to update a project in project insight.

name: Project Life Cycle for Product Development (PLCPD)
description: The Project Life Cycle for Product Development (PLCPD) describes the process to product HL7 ‘products’ including standards and specifications and includes project initiative, analysis and requirements documentation, and specification design. The PLCPD depicted as a cyclical process flow, presents the HL7 strategy for protocol specification development, enhancement, and management, however, as described in the Governance and Operations Manual (GOM) allows Work Groups flexibility to plan their strategy to produce their artifacts.
purpose: Guidance on HL7 strategy for protocol specification development, enhancement, and management.

name: Project Scope Statement Template and Project Approval Process
description: Describes the steps to take a project through the approval process, which is a requirement to ballot standards. There are different approval paths for different types of projects. This zip file also contains the Project Scope Statement templates, including the HL7 Affiliate Project Description template.
purpose: Supports the creation of a Project Scope Statement by giving a template, instructions and information on the apporval process.

name: Recorded Webinar: HL7 Project Management Tool Overview for HL7 Project Facilitators
description: 38 minute recording of a webinar targeted for co-chairs and those leading HL7 projects (i.e. Project Facilitators). This webinar demonstrates HL7 project tools including Project Insight (HL7’s primary project repository), the HL7 Searchable Project Database, GForge, as well as review HL7 project processes and methodologies.
purpose: Supports co-chairs and Project Facilitators in using project tools for management of the project.

name: Recorded Webinar: How to Use The PBS Metrics Excel Report
description: A 9 minute recorded webinar targeted for co-chairs and those leading HL7 projects (i.e. Project Facilitators).  This webinar demonstrates how best to navigate through the Projects, Ballots and Standards Metrics Excel Report
purpose: Supports co-chairs and Project Facilitators in how to navigate through the PBS report.
Notes: You have direct access to the video.

name: Three-Year Plan Guidelines
description: The TSC was requested to provide structure and format guidelines to the Working Groups on creating Three-Year Plans. The Project Services Work Group identified a mechanism where future planning projects can be added to Project Insight for tracking. This document is intended to provide additional guidance on that process.
purpose: Supports work groups in the creation of a tree-year plan. .

name: TSC Guidance on Ballot Levels
description: This document provides information in determining the correct ballot strategy.
purpose: Supports HL7 work groups in determine the correct ballot strategy.

name: HL7 Reference Model
description: The Reference Information Model (RIM) is the cornerstone of the HL7 Version 3 development process. An object model created as part of the Version 3 methodology, the RIM is a large, pictorial representation of the HL7 clinical data (domains) and identifies the life cycle that a message or groups of related messages will carry. It is a shared model between all domains and, as such, is the model from which all domains create their messages. The RIM is an ANSI approved standard.
purpose: Supports HL7 v3 development and implementation.

name: Naming Conventions
description: Versions of the HL7 RIM are available only as Composite ZIP files that contain ALL relevant files for that version. The file names within these archives indicate the type of information available. The naming structure is described on this webpage.
purpose: Supports the use of files containg the HL7 RIM.

name: HL7 Membership Logos
description: HL7 International Logo Site
purpose: Guidance for HL7 members in using the HL7 logo's.

name: EHR-S FM Profile Designer Tool
description: The basis for this tool was The EHR-S FM, release 2. The development of the tool was approved by both the EHR workgroup and the Tooling workgroup, and hence became a full HL7 International tooling project. The tool is developed as an extension for Enterprise Architect from Sparx (Corporate Edition). The HL7 EHR System Functional Model provides a reference list of functions that may be present in an Electronic Health Record System (EHR-S). The function list is described from a user perspective with the intent to enable consistent expression of system functionality. This EHR-S Functional Model, through the creation of Functional Profiles for care settings and realms, enables a standardized description and common understanding of functions sought or available in a given setting (e.g., intensive care, cardiology, office practice in one country or primary care in another country).
purpose:
Supports the creation of Functional Profiles based on the EHR-S FM R2.
Supports the management of the Functional Model and Profiles.
Notes:
Requires Enterprise Architect (Sparx), the corporate edition.
If you want to know more about the tool or get the computable artifacts for this, please contact the co-chaairs of the EHR work group: http://www.hl7.org/Special/committees/ehr/leadership.cfm

name: Manuals for the EHR-S FM Profile Designer tool
description: Manuals created for the use of the HER-S FM Profile Designer Tool.
purpose: Supports the user in the use of the tool when devoloping a Functional Profile.

name: HL7 Message Workbench
description: The Messaging Workbench is a multipurpose productivity tool for HL7 V2.x implementers. It facilitates rapid development of specifications and reports. It also incorporates an online message validation service, and message generator for use in testing.
purpose: Supports the development and validation of a HL7 V2.x messages.

name: C-CDA Examples
description: The approved samples are are listed on a wiki.
purpose: Supports the re-use and creation of C-CDA templates.

name: Standards Knowledge Management Tool
description: Joint Initiative for Global Standards Harmonization Health Informatics Document Registry and Glossary Standards Knowledge Management Tool, SKMT.
purpose:
Coordination of Healthcare glossary terms across multiple SDOs.
The site supports persons seeking to find standards documents or term definitions as well as the standards developer, the publishing administration.

The content of the skmt is owned by the publisher and is published for reference only under agreement with the publishers.  the users do not require any license to use it - only conventioinal copyright referencing expectations. 
For developers, persons who are adding content in the skmt, there is also a user guide  available at http://skmtglossary.org/Doc/SKMTUserGuide.pdf

name: FHIR Build
description: The FHIR Build process take a large number of artifacts (spreadsheets, xml files, other configuration files) and utilizing a combination of XSLT, ANT, and Java builds the FHIR specification including the examples and  the Java and Delphi reference implementations.
purpose: Build the core FHIR specification
technology: ant java xslt excel linux windows macos
Notes: The FHIR Build process cannot run unless it can contact the FHIR Vocabulary Server. Output from the vacabulary server is cache to enhance the performance of the FHIR Build process

name: FHIR IG Publisher Documentation
description: Guidance for developing FHIR implementation guides. The FHIR team provides an IG Publishing tool that takes the implementation guide resources and converts them to a set of 3 different types of files.
purpose: Supports the use of IG publisher for the development of an Implementation Guide for FHIR

name: FHIR IG publisher
description: The HL7 FHIR tool to help with developing an FHIR Implementation Guides.
purpose: Supports the development of an Implementation Guide for FHIR.

name: HL7 Tooling FAQs
description: This Tooling FAQs are intended to provide general support for individuals wanting to use the HL7 tool suite. The FAQs are grouped under five themes: General, RMIM Designer, RoseTree, PubDb and V3 Generator.
purpose: Supports the use of several HL7 tools.

name: FHIR Registry
description: A FHIR profile registry. Find profiles, extensions, valuesets, dictionaries, mappings, examples and more.
purpose: Supports finding and publication of FHIR resources.

name: FORGE
description: The offical FHIR profile authoring tool
purpose: Supports the creation and editing of FHIR Profiles.
Notes: Downloading the tool throught either http://fhir.furore.com/Forge and the FHIR registry, https://simplifier.net/ui/Access/Login, you must first register and login.

name: Spark FHIR server
description: A fully compliant FHIR server developed by Furore, SPARK. SPARK is capable of storing and retrieving all FHIR resources listed in the specification and supports all REST operations. The server has also implemented all search functionality and all search parameters.
purpose: Supports a quick start in FHIR implementations

name: FHIR Main Vocabulary Server
description: The FHIR Main Vocabulary server is a FHIR server that is the source of truth for vocabulary  that is used in the FHIR specification. The external server is maintained by Grahame Greive.
purpose: Provide the core registry of FHIR codes and value sets required to build the FHIR standard

name: C-CDA 2.1 Samples and Query Tool
description: A web query tool to support the searching and retrieval of C-CDA R2.1 sample instances. The tool will process a set of sample files stored in GitHub to produce a database that supports a web interface to specify various query parameters.
purpose: Enable C-CDA implementors to research and retrieve samples instances using a variety terms and words
Notes: Application is being developed and is in design

name: EHR-S FM/FP Publishing
description: An add-on tool to the EHR-S Functional Modeler/Profiler that produces human readable output of the functional model/profile in HTML, PDF and CSV formats. The tool takes a MAX file export of a functional model or profile and using a process defined in ANT and applying a number of XSLT transforms produces an HTML or PDF or CSV format output. The HTML and PDF output contains linkages, indices and navigation to enable reading the specification using simple freely available tools (browsers, Acrobat Reader, etc.).
purpose: Produce output in a human readable form (PDF, HTML, CSV) from a Functional Model or a Functional Profile
technology: ant max xslt fop windows macos linux alone
Notes: Application requires knowledge of running tools on the command line. Installation and run instructions are included in the EHR-S Functional Modeler user documentation

name: DCM MDG file
description: Model Driven Generation (MDG) Technologies allowing users to extend Enterprise Architect's (EA) modeling capabilities to specific domains and notations. In th case of HL7 it is created for UML based Detailed Clinical Models in EA. These models adhere to the ISO TS 13972 which was developed with HL7 and openEHR input. Technically the MDG constrains the UML into a specific stereotype that allows export of the logical model in various technical formats as XML, HL7 v3 clinical statements and MAX.
purpose: The MDG file for DCM can be installed in EA and serves as a template to generate DCMs. These DCMs have: 1. packages with instructions to complete the evidence base, tagged values to create the DCM meta information, including OIDs, the UML model in which each data element is specified as class, and tagged values for the code binding and value set binding. The result is a DCM in UML which can be exported as XMI file.
Notes:
Application requires knowledge in using Enterprise Architect, requires a valid Enterprise Architect installation

Please send issues to: DCMHelpdesk@results4care.eu

name: DCM Content Creator
description: web environment in which clinicians can describe the health knowledge and evidence base for a detailed clinical model. The XML file can be imported into the Enterprise Architect DCM MDG template.
purpose: Expression of health knowledge as background and context of detailed clinical models. Online collaboration tool.
Notes: Please send issues to: DCMHelpdesk@results4care.eu

name: DCM Model Creator
description: extension to Enterprise Architect to support the creation of Detailed Clinical Models
purpose: Tools allow to import IM CEMLs and create UML from them, validates DCMs that are created with the DCM template in EA and follow the stereotyping rules. Export the DCM into various technical representations. Working are XMI, CSV, HL7 v3 XML for clinical statements, MAX and conversion of MAX into JSON. Finally supports composing DCM into larger constructs such as full HL7 v3 message payload. CIMI model export in ADL 2.0 under construction. FHIR resource and extension export under construction.
Notes:
Application requires knowledge in using Enterprise Architect, requires a valid Enterprise Architect installation.

Please send issues to: DCMHelpdesk@results4care.eu

name: Education Portal
description: The site for all of the education services provided by HL7 International
purpose: Provide HL7 education services

name: Model Driven Health Tools
description: MDHT delivers a standard object-oriented alternative to proprietary development methodologies and tooling used to specify and implement most healthcare industry standards. There are three primary categories of users for MDHT tools: authors of healthcare industry interoperability standards, certification or testing authorities who validate that an Electronic Health Record (EHR) system produces XML or JSON files that comply with the standard, and software developers that implement adapters or applications that produce and consume healthcare data. MDHT defines healthcare-specific UML profiles to specify the interoperability standards and delivers model editing tools that are optimized for clinical informatics users, including a customized interface for the UML profile extensions. MDHT also delivers UML publishing tools that are used to generate specification documents that are ready for submission to standards organizations. Finally, the tooling includes model transformations that leverage  EMF and OCL to generate Ecore models and Java code used by healthcare implementers.
purpose: Produce CDA implementation guides and code framework to be used in the development of software the uses the IG

name: CSV to FHIR Tracker
description:
A command line script to load the extracted CSV contents of the ballot comments into Gforge tracker items.

The script was created to aid the FHIR core team manage all comments against the FHIR specification. The script makes use of a number of custom fields created by the FHIR team to track a number of items beyond the tracking fields found in the default GForge tracker.
purpose: Bulk loading of tracker items into Gforge (such as ballot comments).
